Learn the Layout

  • Docs
  • Guides
  • Getting Started
  • Learn the Layout

Expense Tracker has an intuitive and responsive design across the entire platform. While the layout is pretty straightforward, it is easy to overlook some of the finer details. This article will be broken up into 2 sections, the Navigation, and the Overview page.

Navigation

The Navigation contains 6 main sections which are the Overview link, the Documentation link, the Search tool, the Menu Lock toggle, the Light/Dark Mode toggle, and the User Menu.

To learn more about each section, select it from the menu below:

The Overview page contains statistics to all of your Categories and Expenses. This dashboard is primarily used to create new categories and expenses. Once the data has been created, you can interact and filter it in multiple ways to help track your expenses.
The Documentation page contains multiple articles that cover the platform's settings and abilities. These topics can range from basic understandings of the platform to more advanced developer settings such as API endpoints.
The Search tool allows you to dynamically search the content of the platform. This allows you to quickly search topics in the Documentation section or swiftly navigate back to the Overview. You can exit the search tool at any time by clicking outside of it or by selecting the exit button. Additionally, once you search a topic you can use the up & down arrow keys to quickly switch between topics and the enter key to select a topic.
The Menu Lock toggle allows you to turn on & off the menu when scrolling. When reading longer pages of documentation or accessing the platform on a mobile device, the menu can take up valuable space. By unlocking the menu, it will be hidden when you scroll down and will become visible when scrolling up.
The Light/Dark Mode toggle allows you to switch content from a light ambience to a dark one. This can help save your valuable eye sight when using the Expense Tracker during evenings.
The User Menus allows you to quickly access documentation as well as logout of the platform. When logging out of the platform, all user settings are erased. This includes filters, date ranges, and API token information.

Overview

The Overview page contains 3 main sections which is the Categories section, the Expenses section, and the Category Breakdown section.

To learn more about each section, select it from the menu below:

The Categories section shows you a list of your existing categories. This section shows you the category's name, unique icon, and the total sum of all of its expenses. These category entities act like an overarching entity to the expense entities. We will cover the relationship between category entities and expense entities in a later section of this guide. In this section, you can click each category to view its data as well as edit or delete it.
The Category Breakdown section shows you the expenses broken down by its category and date in an interactive bar chart. You can interact with the data by hovering over a given bar to see its value and category. In addition to this, you can toggle which categories are shown by clicking one from the upper legend. More advanced filtering is avalible which we will cover in a later section of this guide.
The Expense section shows you a comprehensive list of your expense. This displays the expense's name, the percentage of the category total it takes up, the category, and the date the expense was processed. Each expense has a parent category which we will cover in a later section of this guide. In this section, you can click each expense to view its data as well as edit or delete it.
The Take a Tour button can assist you should you forget what each section is responsible for. It will guide you through each section and clarify it's purpose. You can exit the tour at any time by clicking outside of it's pop-up box.
